oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Canary Culture: Concepts in Genetics (part 4)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bucci, Tony
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: My last article dealt with sex-linkedinheritance. We learned how the sexlinkedcharacteristic can exhibit itselfas dominant or recessive. Also, welearned which colors and/or mutationsare sex-linked. I neglected to includethe "Satinette" as one of the sex-linkedmutations. Satinette factor has a greateffect of diluting the melanin pigment,especially the black. Also, it has effectson the pigment in the eyes. Satinette, inappearance, is an Isabel with red eyes.Satinette factor is sex-linked recessiveto all other factors. Satinette is not to beconfused with the "Ino" canarywhose eyes are also red. The Ino factoris autosomal recessive.
